Title: Data Analyst - Data Visualisation Squad
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (all genders) to join the Data Visualization team on our journey to provide BI data solutions to support developers and business users in accessing, comprehending, and reporting data seamlessly.

The Global Data Platform team focuses on complex, international, multi-domain problems affecting the core of Delivery Hero’s business and operations across the globe. The impact here drives millions of euros of value for the business, from building our global data backbone to crafting scalable, production models and APIs, to generating actionable insights that can change the competitive landscape of continents. We’re a large, diverse team of engineers, data scientists, data analysts, and product managers comprising Platforms, Analytics, and Data Products. We drive value by helping DeliveryHero’s businesses, systems, and people make better decisions faster at scale. We want to attract and train world-class engineers, data scientists, and product managers and build a group that provides you with the most productive and challenging time of your career.

Your Mission:


Engage with local and global teams to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and help to translate this into data products.
Refine, challenge, and support requests from stakeholders and create new data analyses based on commonly defined specifications
Analyze trends in our data and provide insight and explanation to our local teams to improve their operations using data
Help identify, define, and specify future insight and data needs to support the different business units
Improve existing procedures; identify the needs for new procedures; train and advocate the team on quality improvements
Collaborate with other data analysts, data engineers, and product owners


What you need to be successful


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data Analyst working for internet companies
You have at least a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative subject, e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering
You are proficient in SQL
You have practical experience with big data tools (e.g Redshift, BigQuery)
You have experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
You have an independent and rigorous working style
You are a team player and love to think outside the box
You have the ability to understand business challenges and stakeholders' needs
Good English communication skills


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you


Strong business understanding in e-commerce or related industries
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects (or proven records)
Proven records in adopting and improving team standards and processes
Experience with other languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and plotting (R, Pandas, Malplotlib, Numpy…)


We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst- Geocoding, Opendata, exploratory data analysis, NLP




Want to Help Revolutionise Last-Mile Logistics with Precision and Efficiency?




Interested? Join the Data Analytics Team!




We've partnered with a leading german startup who provide a geo-based and AI powered product to help transform the last mile logistics industry. Imagine building a product which is used by industry leaders such as AWS and google.




Were looking for Data analysts who have experience in :




processing geocode requests and working in an open source proprietary data platform.
Experienced in either ( Python, Node, Kotlin, Java, Node Js).
Experienced in working with Geospatial data projects.




On top of this if you are interested in working in an environment which prioritises Machine learning and NLP then this role will be for you!

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for an analytically-minded and data-passionate Data Analyst to join our Tech team. This position is perfect for someone who wants to grow their career in a dynamic startup environment and make a direct impact on the success of our food delivery company through data-driven insights.


Perform strategic data analyses with direct impact to decision making of leadership team
Help building data pipelines and data models
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports that are effective in helping stakeholders monitor key performance indicators and easily make decisions
Serve as a point of contact for ad-hoc data questions and requests


Required

About you


Background in a STEM degree, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience with one or more scripting languages, e.g. Python or JavaScript
Good knowledge of SQL and initial experience with visualization/BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Metabase)
First experience in data analytics either through internships or a full-time position
Excellent problem solving skills and always work in a solution-oriented and detailed manner
Curious and self-driven approach, as well as the ability to extract clear objectives and requirements from broad challenges or questions
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders
Fluent in German


Nice to have / Big Plus:


Data warehousing experience with dbt
Experience with cloud services, e.g. GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
Understanding of ETL (/ELT) processes
Experience working with ambiguity in a scale-up (or scale-up-like) environment


5 Reasons to join LANCH


Huge growth & even bigger growth ahead


LANCH is the fastest growing consumer company in DACH ever and it’s still the very beginning. A journey like this brings massive career growth trajectory for you.


Work with experiences founders & C-Level


Serial founders who have exited companies to Netflix, DeliveryHero, Bird and experienced C-Level such as the former DACH CEO of Oatly.


Trusted by the best investors out there


Raised oversubscribed pre-seed to Series A rounds in less than a year in the toughest venture market. Backed by Europe’s best investors such as HV Capital, Felix Capital, founders of FlixBus, Flaschenpost, Foodora, Foodspring, Glovo, Wolt or superstars like Mario Götze, Knossi, Luciano, André Schürrle & more.


Early enough to have huge impact but late enough to know the business works & scales fast


Timing is everything: joining LANCH now is the perfect timing. We already know the business works and we are planning to make >€50m in this 2nd year. However, we are still small and you will have massive impact and career growth ahead.


Culture, fun, success - join a great team


We make value-centered decisions and invest a lot in building an amazing team. We go skiing, rent castles and do cool things together. All while building a massive company.

About Us

At LANCH, we empower small gastronomy owners by giving them the tools needed to make food delivery fun again. We are building the world’s biggest virtual food court by creating high-quality delivery brands together with the megastars of our generation. LANCH is food delivery built for 2024. Backed by HV Capital, Felix Capital and a bunch of superstar angels such as the founders of FlixBus, Gorillas, Flaschenpost, Glovo, Foodspring, Foodora, Honest Food, Finleap and the most known YouTubers, rap stars and athletes of our time.

LIFE AT LANCH


A steep learning curve with a high career growth trajectory and massive ownership
Hybrid working and flexible working hours combined with a fair target salary
Offsite team events and regular get-togethers
Unique team spirit and flat hierarchies
Amazing 40 people team & highly experienced leadership team to learn from
Value-centered decision making: fast, transparent, creative and fun
Team offsites every 16 weeks to come together in-person & strengthen our relationships
Complete ownership on every level
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Digital Marketing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?


About You

General Requirements:


Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
Excellent written and spoken English.


Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)


Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
Causal inference and geo experimentation experience


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you’ll be doing

Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It’s also a plus if you have…

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Data Analyst - Spatial Data
Description:
Looking for an opportunity to work with large-scale geospatial data in a dynamic and innovative environment? Passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams?




We're recruiting a Data Analyst on behalf of our clients in Berlin, a forward thinking tech startup. This is a great opportunity to join their team and contribute to building a scalable, high-performing platform that serves billions of requests. This role focuses on statistical analysis, KPI reporting, and supporting data-driven decision-making to enhance product performance.




Key responsibilities:

Own and streamline KPI reporting processes to track system performance and quality metrics.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and drive optimizations.
Analyze complex data streams to answer key stakeholder questions and provide actionable insights.
Build dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Contribute to data exploration and migration initiatives, supporting infrastructure improvements.




Key skills:

Solid experience with SQL and your preferred data tools or languages (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js).
Strong expertise in KPI reporting and visualization tools, such as AWS Quicksight or alternatives
Ability to derive insights from unstructured data and present findings to diverse audiences.
Collaborative mindset with experience working across engineering, product, and business teams.
Proactive and self-driven problem-solving approach with excellent communication skills in English.




Bonus points for:

Experience analyzing geospatial data or data quality metrics.




Interested, or know someone who would be? Click Apply or get in touch directly on iroghina@trg-uk.com

Title: Performance Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 2,500 products with focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 80 cities in Germany, the Netherlands and France. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala and Bond and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

Job Description


Provide data-driven insights to support management in resource planning and strategic decision-making.
Analyze historical data and trends to identify areas for improvement in forecasting accuracy and staffing efficiency.
Create detailed reports and dashboards to communicate forecast accuracy, staffing metrics, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather input and ensure alignment in planning processes.


Qualifications


Bachelor in data analysis/data science/IT or Economics.
Analytical mindset, ability to interpret and translate data into actionable insights
Advanced knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Excel
Other programming languages are a plus (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript etc)
Excellent written and spoken communication in English and German
Willingness to relocate to Berlin


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals.
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days.
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers.
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership.
Attractive company pension options.
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses.
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens.
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance.


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




The EU Data Analytics team at Trip.com empowers data-driven decisions with accurate, timely, and actionable insights. As a Market Data Analyst, you’ll collaborate with EU Strategists and cross-functional teams to drive business growth.




Joining the analytics team, you’ll own the full lifecycle—from data extraction to generating insights that inform decisions. Your role will include designing tracking systems, creating visualisations, building dashboards, and conducting exploratory analyses.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Conduct integrated analyses of market competition, trends, and business performance to generate actionable insights that fuel growth.
Identify key market trends and uncover new business opportunities through comprehensive data analysis.
Monitor and analyse critical business metrics, including demand, supply, traffic, funnel conversion rates, and market share.
Proactively identify and quantify key issues, communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a timely manner.
Partner with strategy, product, growth, and campaign teams across the EU, HQ, and global locations to align efforts with market growth strategies and global business goals.
Own and deliver the weekly market report, providing insights on market developments and tracking the progress of key projects.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

5+ years of experience in data or business analysis, with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering).
Strong SQL skills are a must, with proficiency in Tableau, Excel, BigQuery, and Hive for data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical and statistical skills, with the ability to solve problems, uncover insights, and communicate them effectively to stakeholders.
A self-starter with a curious mindset, comfortable working in ambiguity and fast-paced environments with minimal oversight.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills across teams and organizations.
Experience in the travel industry and a portfolio of past work are a plus.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Category Management
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

Join Vinted's Category Management team, where we drive Vinted’s expansion into new categories and the improvement of existing ones. Our team focuses on understanding, developing and expanding the structure of our catalog. We work closely with Product teams across Vilnius and Berlin to ensure that our category tree and navigation tools fulfill the needs of our members and are easy to use.

Next to the Category Management team, you will be a part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within DSA, we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore, our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for generating actionable insights and identifying and scoping opportunities. They maintain and contribute to automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for the identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and designing, developing and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Analyse questions and identified opportunities relating to category changes and improvements to understand their scope and impact
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Collaborate with Taxonomists to enable them to use a data-driven approach to Taxonomy Design and category structure
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing, ensure the features have appropriate tracking, and analyse the results of tests and experiments
Support the Ontologies Platform (engineering) team to answer their data analytics questions
Communicate findings and recommendations to relevant stakeholders


About You


Demonstrated working experience as a Decision Scientist, Analyst, or other role with a strong data component (typically 2+ years of working experience).
Strong background in statistics (modelling, experimentation).
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (preferably Python).
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related quantitative field.
Excellent written and spoken English.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Club
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,500 - € 77,900 gross per year.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,500 - € 77,900 gross per year.

Title: Product Analyst (Data team)
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:


Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights



Qualifications:


Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience



Key Skills:


Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving



Additional Skills:


Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

Title: Working Student Data Analysis (m/w/d) Berlin, Hamburg, München
Description:
1KOMMA5°

We are looking for you to join our tech team in Berlin, Munich, or Hamburg. 1KOMMA5° is creating Germany's largest one-stop-shop for the sale, installation, and servicing of solar panels, heat pumps, electricity solutions, and charging infrastructure. And the best part? These assets are seamlessly integrated into the energy market, and we are focused on optimizing their performance to maximize their impact. Be a part of our mission and shape the base of our tech products - the integrations!

Become a part of our mission and learn more about our Product & Tech team!

Deine Position

As part of a cross-functional team in the Heartbeat Tech domain, you will focus on analysing data passing through our interfaces to find errors and discrepancies, identify the root cause of these and then generate solutions to increase data accuracy. By doing this you will play an integral role in making the Heartbeat AI more robust and provide a high platform stability and exceptional customer experience.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Technical Contribution: Make sense of large data sets and identify unexpected behavior. Take an active approach in trying to understand possible root causes for this unexpected behavior identified and present this in a succinct and efficient manner
Collaboration: Ingest data from other teams and discuss your findings with them directly. Challenge other people and processes and be challenged
Optimization: Become an expert in the workings of our optimization and use data to explain system behavior internally and externally
Innovation Initiatives: Contribute to fostering a culture of innovation and experimentation within the team to continuously improve our products and processes. Drive these initiatives together with internal and external stakeholders towards rapid execution to manifest 1KOMMA5° leading role in the market
Act as a point of contact for our partner network and OEM partners, and interacting directly with them


Dein Profil

The Successful Candidate Will Have


Enrolled at a university and contribute 20 hours per week
Studying a relevant degree program (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science)
Strong communication and organisational skills
Experience refining ambiguous requirements and finding your way around in cross-functional teams in a fast pace, interdisciplinary working environment
An agile and result-oriented mindset and you consider yourself a team player
Comfortable owning tasks and work streams from day one
Very good knowledge of spoken and written English (German is a plus)


Bonus Points For


Experience with Modbus TCP hardware integration
Knowledge around the Energy markets, products or ecosystem
Experience and interest in climate tech industry


Benefits


You are part of a dynamic and highly motivated team with people who have proven that they can make things happen and move companies forward
With your work, you accelerate the "energy and mobility transition" and make a concrete contribution to the sustainable transformation of our energy infrastructure
You move in flat hierarchies and have direct contact with the managing directors as well as short decision-making paths
Work with and learn from other skilled engineers
You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in Berlin, Hamburg or Munich
See the direct impact of your work on a rapid-scaling user base
Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass


Über uns

Die 1KOMMA5° Gruppe ist ein CleanTech Unicorn mit der Mission alles zu elektrifizieren und über unsere KI-basierte Software Plattform Heartbeat AI jeden an den Strommarkt der Zukunft anzuschließen. Wir sind das marktführende Unternehmen für die Installation von CO2-neutralen Energiesystemen, insbesondere bei Photovoltaik, Energiespeicher, Wallbox, Wärmepumpe und Energiemanagement. 1KOMMA5° vereint die besten Unternehmen Deutschlands, Europas und darüber hinaus - wir wachsen weiter und das weltweit.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)




Company Description




AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.




Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!










Job Description




Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities

Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.

Job Requirements

Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.










What do we offer?

Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
30 days of annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work




Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Show more

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528
Show more

As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do

  • Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
  • Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
  • Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
  • Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
  • Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
  • Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
  • Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams

What You'll Bring

  • Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
  • Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
  • Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
  • Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
  • Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
  • Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
  • A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
  • You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528

Title: User Growth Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




We are seeking a User Growth Data Analyst to join our User Growth Team, a group dedicated to expanding and engaging our customer base. In this role, you will optimize customer communication channels, analyse performance, and develop strategies to improve onboarding, engagement, and retention. The ideal candidate is data-driven, analytical, and passionate about creating seamless customer experiences.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Analyse new user acquisition, retention, LTV, and CRM performance to identify growth opportunities and improve onboarding, engagement, and retention strategies.
Monitor and optimize CRM activities (e.g., campaigns, incentives, referral programs) and communication channels using key metrics and customer segmentation based on behaviour, demographics, and preferences.
Conduct in-depth research using large datasets in BigQuery to test hypotheses, uncover trends, and provide actionable recommendations.
Define and track KPIs for CRM projects, analysing factors that drive performance and applying statistical techniques to validate results.
Collaborate with HQ BI teams to ensure accurate data collection and reporting, and present findings with actionable insights to stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decisions and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

5+ years of hands-on technical experience in user growth, CRM, or retention-focused roles, with strong SQL skills a must, statistical knowledge, and proficiency in tools like Tableau, Excel, or BigQuery.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Business).
Proven ability to perform qualitative and quantitative analyses, identify root causes, and deliver actionable insights with a user-focused mindset.
Experience analysing user acquisition, retention, LTV, and CRM performance to drive growth strategies.
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to present findings clearly to stakeholders of all technical levels.
Strong attention to detail, ownership, and a structured, results-driven approach to problem-solving.
Experience in the travel industry and a portfolio of past work are a plus.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x) - Marketing
Description:
At Quandoo, we bring gastronomy and technology together.

Since launching in December 2012, we have continuously grown and are now active in 12 countries around the world such as Australia, Germany, Italy and the United Kingdom. With plans to develop even further, our mission is clear: To transform the world’s dining-out experiences.

We offer diners the opportunity to discover and make reservations at restaurants via our website or mobile app. We also provide restaurants with innovative management tools that enable them to build relationships with new & existing guests, streamline their day-to-day service and maximise their overall potential.

As an employer we are committed to the growth of every team member and support collaboration across organizational boundaries. We deeply care about what we do, we are respectful, open and have faith in our colleagues abilities.

This is why our core values are fundamental to us:




have a growth mindset

feel responsible

be united.




Job Description




We are looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/x) to join the Data & Analytics Team at Quandoo.




Your responsibilities will include




Taking initiatives on projects that contribute to overall business success, including collaborations with other business verticals
Contributing to the growth and efficiency of the Data & Analytics team
Working closely with the Marketing team, including Performance Marketing & CRM, to analyse the performance of different types of campaigns and share actionable insights for optimisation and growth
Ensuring data quality, consistency, and governance by maintaining and improving data pipelines and reporting frameworks.
Automating reporting & manual processes for operational efficiency
Working with stakeholders to define data and reporting requirements
Performing ad-hoc analyses, deepdives and root-cause analyses to support decision making
Supporting with marketing tracking implementation if needed




Qualifications




University degree in Economics, Statistics, Math, CS or similar field
3-5 years of working experience in a similar role
Sound knowledge of SQL & Python and relational databases
Experience in interpreting data in Data Analytics, Marketing Analytics, Business Intelligence or a related field
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau or Looker
Analytical mindset and proactive attitude towards problem solving
Ability to communicate effectively with business stakeholders
Analysis experience with tracking systems and measurement tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Yandex etc)
Knowledge of Google Ads, Meta Ads, or other paid marketing platforms and their analytics




What makes you stand out:




Marketplace knowledge
Experience using DBT
Basic knowledge of Javascript and tag management systems (for eg GTM)
Prior exposure to Marketing and Product KPIs, Paid Search, Bidding




Additional Information




We care about our company culture. This is what you can expect with us:




You have the chance to get a job in a rapidly growing international company. We are offering a new and exciting opportunity with a global commerce platform. We are leading the way in technology based reservations, bookings and table management, and you will play a crucial role in our organisation's growth and ultimately benefit from our success and expansion.




High level of responsibility – the chance to hit the ground running from day one and shape your own career path.
We believe in your abilities: This position offers you a tangible impact on the company's success while you benefit from flexible working opportunities in a well-balanced work environment.
You will work with a highly motivated and skilled team from all over the world. We celebrate our diversity!
Fun working environment – opportunity to collaborate with highly motivated colleagues and attend company parties, the weekly Qweekend and Quandoo’s Global Summit.




Here are our Benefits:




Access to Quandoo’s pension scheme.
Be flexible: Enjoy our remote policy and work from our offices, at home or while traveling.
Got balance: We offer flexible working hours and up to 30 days of vacation.
Stay mentally fit: Use our free 1:1 sessions with professional psychologists as well as digital trainings and tools for your mental health - provided by our partner nilo.health.
Stay physically fit: Work out while getting great discounts at Urban Sports Club and Fitness First.
No boredom! Quandoo offers challenges and development every day. Our self development budget will help you acquiring and achieving new skills & knowledge.
Save real money: Get new discounts every month on offers from over 1.500 companies and brands - provided by our partner Corporate Benefits.
Be prepared for your retirement: Benefit from our Company Pension Scheme and get a 30% contribution for your pension.







Want to be part of Quandoo’s future? Apply now!

Great job, but not right for you? Recommend this position to your contacts!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Mission

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst, der komplexe Datensätze analysiert und aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse liefert, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools, um Datenprozesse zu optimieren und die Qualität des Reportings zu verbessern. Fundierte Kenntnisse in Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS oder GCP sind essenziell, ebenso wie Erfahrung mit Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery. Darüber hinaus arbeitest du eng mit cross-funktionalen Teams zusammen, unterstützt ETL-Workflows und nutzt dbt, um die Datenverarbeitung zu optimieren. Deine Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und dich in einem dynamischen Umfeld schnell anzupassen, ist entscheidend für den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.

Dein Profil


Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS und/oder GCP.
Expertise in Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery.
Kenntnisse in ETL-Workflows, Datenbankmanagementsystemen und dbt (Data Build Tool).
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich.
Erfahrung im Finanzsektor ist von Vorteil, aber nicht erforderlich.


Über uns

Die Smartbroker-Gruppe betreibt unter anderem den Smartbroker+ – einen mehrfach ausgezeichneten Online-Broker, der als einziger Anbieter in Deutschland das umfangreiche Produktspektrum der klassischen Broker mit den äußerst günstigen Konditionen der Neobroker verbindet. Zum Portfolio gehört außerdem der digitale Fondsvermittler SMARTBROKER Finance (vormals: FondsDISCOUNT.de), gleichzeitig betreibt die Gruppe vier reichweitenstarke Börsenportale (wallstreet-online.de, boersenNews.de, FinanzNachrichten.de und ARIVA.de). Mit mehreren Hundert Millionen monatlichen Seitenaufrufen ist die Gruppe der größte verlagsunabhängige Finanzportalbetreiber im deutschsprachigen Raum und unterhält außerdem die größte Finanz-Community.

Das Unternehmen gehört zu den Pionieren des digitalen Investments. Seit mehr als 25 Jahren setzen wir uns dafür ein, die Hürden bei der Geldanlage abzubauen und eine nutzerfreundliche und preisgünstige Abwicklung von Investments zu ermöglichen.

Der Schlüssel zu diesem Erfolg sind unsere Mitarbeiter:innen. Aufgrund der starken Wachstumsdynamik haben wir in den vergangenen Jahren zahlreiche attraktive Arbeitsplätze geschaffen. Jeden Tag streben wir danach, das beste Team aufzubauen und unseren Mitarbeiter:innen den Raum zu geben, sich selbst bestmöglich zu entwickeln. Ein vielfältiges Team aus Leistungsträgern sorgt dafür, dass wir alle jeden Tag dazulernen. Aus einem kleinen Team mit ca. 20 Personen sind wir inzwischen ein Unternehmen mit rund 260 Mitarbeiter:innen (Stand 31.12.2023) geworden, das in einem modernen Büro in Berlin-Kreuzberg sitzt.

Wir verstehen uns als innovatives Fintech, das in eine erfolgreiche Unternehmensgruppe eingebettet ist und damit persönliche Arbeitsatmosphäre mit den Vorteilen einer finanzstarken Aktiengesellschaft verbindet. In allen Unternehmensteilen setzen wir auf flache Hierarchien, individuelle Entwicklung und agile Prozesse. Wir sind stolz auf den persönlichen Zusammenhalt im Team und die überdurchschnittlich lange Betriebszugehörigkeit vieler Angestellter. Wir setzen uns für Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit ein. Wir streben danach, ein Team aufzubauen, das eine Vielzahl von Hintergründen, Perspektiven und Fähigkeiten repräsentiert. Je integrativer wir sind, desto besser wird unsere Arbeit und unser Team sein.

Wenn auch du Teil dieses schnell wachsenden Unternehmens werden möchtest, dann bewirb dich jetzt bei der Smartbroker Gruppe.

Wir ermutigen Frauen, nicht-binäre und Transgender-Personen sowie alle Mitglieder der LGBTQI+-Community, Menschen mit marginalisiertem ethnischen Hintergrund und Menschen mit sichtbaren oder nicht sichtbaren Behinderungen, sich zu bewerben, wenn sie ein integratives, vielfältiges und sicheres Arbeitsumfeld suchen.
