Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir von der Lidl e-commerce schaffen als digitaler Systembereitsteller für das Onlinegeschäft von Lidl effiziente, skalierbare digitale Produkte und Services und entwickeln diese zukunftsfähig weiter.

Als Marke der IT- und Digitalsparte Schwarz Digits unterteilen sich unsere Bereiche in Commerce Platforms, Marketing Tech & Enablement, Data Tech & Enablement, New Digital Business Models sowie SCRM Loyalty Platforms.

Deine Aufgaben


Als Analyst unterstützt du den Fachbereich mit aussagekräftigen Analysen, um die strategische Ausrichtung zu steuern und zu evaluieren
Du entwickelst und wartest Datenpipelines zur Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von Daten für das Management, Marketing und deine Kollegen
Du stellst komplexe Zusammenhänge zielgruppengerecht dar und hilfst so dem Fachbereich, Wissen aufzubauen
Du unterstützt den Fachbereich in der Planung, Durchführung und Auswertung von verschiedenen Projekten und leitest selbständig Projekte und Analysen ab
Du konzipierst und implementierst automatisierte Prozesse, um die Produktivität von dir und deinen Kollegen zu erhöhen
Du identifizierst Optimierungspotenziale und setzt Maßnahmen um, um die Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit zu maximieren


Dein Profil


Du besitzt einen Hochschulabschluss in Volkswirtschaftslehre, Ökonometrie, Statistik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du konntest bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst oder Data Engineer sammeln
Du hast Erfahrung mit Datenbank- und Tabellenmodellen (Data Lakehouse, Data Vault etc.).
Du hast ein datengetriebenes Mindset und gehst sicher mit gängigen Analytics-Tools (z.B. Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery) und Sprachen (Python, SQL) um
Du besitzt eine Hands-on-Mentalität und hast Lust darauf, den Bereich aufzubauen und weiterzuentwickeln
Du bist geduldig, teamfähig und hast Humor
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und gut Englisch
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) - SAP & Finance
Description:
At Statista, we’re all about facts and data, for we are the world's leading business data platform. By providing reliable and easy-to-use data as well as various data analytics products and services, we empower people worldwide to make fact-based decisions.

Founded in Hamburg in 2007, we have quickly grown into a global company with offices in major cities such as London, New York, Berlin and Tokyo. And we still have a lot of plans. Our constant growth does not only prove our success, but also keeps creating new development and career opportunities for our employees.

We value and celebrate our diverse culture. You are welcome here for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or whether you prefer bar graphs to pie charts. Your story matters – keep writing it as part of our team.

Are you ready to join us?

Tasks


Assume responsibility for the development and refinement of the data models in our Redshift data warehouse.
Help transition our current MS Navision-based financial reporting to a newly designed SAP-based reporting.
Act as a bridge between Finance Controlling, Finance Tech and Data Department. Systematically translate business requirements and questions into precise data queries and insightful data models.
Provide crucial support to our Embedded Analysts and Finance Controlling Team, aiding in their understanding and utilization of the data warehouse.
Engage with stakeholders across the organization driving value from our data.


Requirements


Proven proficiency in SQL and experience working with data warehouses like Redshift.
Hands-on data modeling skills and familiarity with dbt.
Understanding of SAP-data and the SAP-system as well as Finance processes.
Adeptness in translating business needs into data models.
Exceptional communication skills in both spoken and written in English. German is a plus.
Analytical mindset with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


The team

At Statista Tech, our mission is to to harness the possibilities of modern technology to bring Statista’s data assets to the fingertips of our customers around the globe as conveniently and reliably as possible. Internally, we provide a productive digital workplace environment at Statista globally.

What We Offer

In addition to our great team, culture, and our shared goal of empowering people with data, there are many other things that make Statista a great place to work! Join us and benefit from:


Work from abroad 10 days a year
Hybrid work and flex-time
International team and social events
Career & training opportunities
Attractive locations and modern offices
Mental health support by Fürstenberg Institute


Some of the benefits listed here apply only to the German entity and to Junior-level roles or above.
Show more

Founded in Hamburg in 2007, we have quickly grown into a global company with offices in major cities such as London, New York, Berlin and Tokyo. And we still have a lot of plans. Our constant growth does not only prove our success, but also keeps creating new development and career opportunities for our employees.

We value and celebrate our diverse culture. You are welcome here for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or whether you prefer bar graphs to pie charts. Your story matters – keep writing it as part of our team.

Are you ready to join us?

Tasks

  • Assume responsibility for the development and refinement of the data models in our Redshift data warehouse.
  • Help transition our current MS Navision-based financial reporting to a newly designed SAP-based reporting.
  • Act as a bridge between Finance Controlling, Finance Tech and Data Department. Systematically translate business requirements and questions into precise data queries and insightful data models.
  • Provide crucial support to our Embedded Analysts and Finance Controlling Team, aiding in their understanding and utilization of the data warehouse.
  • Engage with stakeholders across the organization driving value from our data.

Requirements

  • Proven proficiency in SQL and experience working with data warehouses like Redshift.
  • Hands-on data modeling skills and familiarity with dbt.
  • Understanding of SAP-data and the SAP-system as well as Finance processes.
  • Adeptness in translating business needs into data models.
  • Exceptional communication skills in both spoken and written in English. German is a plus.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data.
  • Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

The team

At Statista Tech, our mission is to to harness the possibilities of modern technology to bring Statista’s data assets to the fingertips of our customers around the globe as conveniently and reliably as possible. Internally, we provide a productive digital workplace environment at Statista globally.

What We Offer

In addition to our great team, culture, and our shared goal of empowering people with data, there are many other things that make Statista a great place to work! Join us and benefit from:

  • Work from abroad 10 days a year
  • Hybrid work and flex-time
  • International team and social events
  • Career & training opportunities
  • Attractive locations and modern offices
  • Mental health support by Fürstenberg Institute

Some of the benefits listed here apply only to the German entity and to Junior-level roles or above.

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Was wir suchen ...



Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schlüsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.



Deine Aufgaben



Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.
Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.
Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.
Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.
Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.
Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen





Dein Profil



fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)
umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools
schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben
service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus
visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln
Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen
Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen
akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen






Warum wir?



Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.
Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.
Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.
28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).
Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.
Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!
Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.
Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.
Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.
Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.
Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.





Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!



Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!



Über uns



Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 5+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You’ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
5+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of 70+ ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world's most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+ team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to learn more about what it's like to work here

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven't done before. You might just discover skills you didn't know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About you

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

  • Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
  • Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
  • Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.

Title: (Data) Supply Analytics Manager (m / f / d )
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable the use of data to drive fast, accurate decision-making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

As a part of this change, we are building a new function dedicated to supporting our supply of travel inventory. This is a role offering huge variety, onboarding, and monitoring our suppliers through the whole lifecycle, ensuring we are best using their inventory and working with finance to ensure the correct allocation of commissions and invoicing.

The role also takes responsibility for zooming out from suppliers and looking across whole modes (e.g. trains, buses, ferries) and geographies (initially European countries only).

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Define and adopt efficient automation around supplier onboarding, performance measurement and financial reconciliation.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 5 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Ideally some experience of B2B or B2B2C environments.
Experience in working with European travel providers would be a significant advantage.
Experience of line management, leading and developing a small team.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively.
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
GCP, BigQuery, Looker, Python, Spark

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Data Analytics Working Student
Description:
About The Role

As a Working Student in our Analytics Team, you will work closely with our Tech, Product, Marketing and Operations team to support our daily operations with analytical insights and help us to grow. You will be joining a dynamic, fast-paced start-up where you’ll have ownership and impact from day one!

Your Responsibilities


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements
Support teams with data and analytics requests and provide analytics solutions
Create and maintain company dashboards
Carry out stand-alone analytics projects in marketing, operations or product
Assist in developing, improving and scaling existing data pipelines


Your Profile


Currently enrolled in a relevant study program with a strong quantitative background (e.g. mathematics, computer science, data science, business informatics etc.)
Good knowledge of Google Sheets
Good Knowledge of SQL
Good Knowledge of Python
Knowledge of common data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Lookerstudio etc.)
Knowledge of dbt, GCP, BigQuery is a plus
Fluent in English


OUR OFFER


WALK THE TALK: Unlimited BEAT81 workouts for you and one family member/friend: we guarantee that you will get fit working here :)
YOUR DEVICE: Everyone has their own preferences when it comes to technology - whether it’s Mac or Windows - you choose your laptop. Additionally, we provide Bose noise-canceling headphones
HYBRID WORK: We have a beautiful office in the heart of Berlin (Weinmeisterstraße) with free drinks, healthy snacks and fruits. We like to spend time there together, but you are also welcome to work from home
FLEXIBLE WORKING HOURS: Early bird or late riser? Shape your workday to align with your personal commitments and preferences in coordination with your team and the business needs
TEAM RITUALS: Shared experiences build a strong team culture. That’s why we have our usuals such as regular all hands meetings, Aperol Thursdays and joint workouts - there is something for everyone
TEAM EVENTS: Our summer and Christmas parties have become as legendary as our annual off-sites and the perfect occasion to spend quality time with team members
Show more

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. Title: Senior Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how we should prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor Management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, Digital Sales, Sales Enablement)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient using orchestration tools (preferably DBT + Airflow)
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Proficient in at least one Visualisation tool (preferably Tableau)
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Ability to correctly present findings to senior stakeholders
Critical thinking and Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Asset Management (f/m/x) - 1 year limited contract
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Translate partner requirements for visibility into the health of refinanced assets (systems installed at customer sites) into meaningful KPIs, then deliver them in the form of reports and dashboards and useful models in the data warehouse.
As part of the Asset Management BI team, work closely with the SVP of Asset Management and directors responsible for quality management, collections, and financial partner relations. Define and provide visibility into departmental performance metrics and actively contribute to continuous improvement through in-depth operational reporting.
Take ownership of end-to-end solutions to business challenges, including essential project scoping, prioritization, expert interviews, wireframing, subsequent iterative delivery, feedback-based improvements, and documentation of data products.
Collaborate on your team with other BI professionals and across departments with data engineers and solution developers to get the job done.
Build, test, document, and review data models in our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt and version control system.
Help your business colleagues with reporting in Excel and Tableau by sharing best practices and providing first-hand assistance with complex cases.
Actively participate in departmental activities aimed at advancing the company's analytical standards and best practices. Contribute to the development of a strong data culture by sharing knowledge and staying updated on the latest BI methodologies and tools.



Qualifications


2+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence or data analytics, exposure to financial, ERP data, capital markets, or risk modelling is a strong plus.
High proficiency in SQL, Tableau (or similar), Excel. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Knowledge of Python for data cleansing and analysis is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of automating reporting workflows and using data to improve decision making and business outcomes.
Proactive and strong focus on collaboration with multiple stakeholders.
Ability to present data products and communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels of management.



Additional Information

Work in Germany's first green unicorn and actively shape the solar energy revolution.


The sun shines all over the world - at Enpal you will find a highly motivated and diverse team with more than 65 different nationalities.
Would you rather keep your pet company at home or your colleagues at the office? Even after the pandemic, we offer you a hybrid working model.
We fulfill every start-up cliché - in our modern office in Berlin-Friedrichshain, you'll find everything your heart desires, from a ping-pong table and yoga corner to a roof terrace and stocked drinks fridges.
Your kick-start at Enpal - Get to know the company, your team colleagues and our founder Mario on your onboarding day.
Stay up to date - Whether it's company figures at our monthly all-hands meetings or how a photovoltaic system works at the Lunch & Learn, you'll always know exactly what's going on.
Energy transition only works together - At Enpal, you can expect a legendary team spirit and unforgettable team events.
No mistakes, no progress - We live a strong feedback culture and grow with your input, either personally or anonymously via our feedback tool Culture Amp.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made on the basis of skin colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

  • Actively participate in departmental activities aimed at advancing the company's analytical standards and best practices. Contribute to the development of a strong data culture by sharing knowledge and staying updated on the latest BI methodologies and tools.

No decisions are made on the basis of skin colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst (Maternity Cover)
Description:
Blinkist connects people with powerful ideas from leading authors and experts to broaden perspectives, gain knowledge, and spark understanding in all areas of their life, both personal and professional.

Used by over 28 million people worldwide, Blinkist distills the key ideas from the most relevant, impactful books and podcasts. These can be read or listened to in 15-minute summaries, that we call Blinks.

Together with Go1, our parent brand, who gives organizations and their employees access to the largest curated e-learning library on the planet, we’re on a mission to reach one billion learners as we unlock positive potential through a love of learning. ✨

About The Role

At Blinkist, we’ve built a platform that transforms the key insights from the world’s best nonfiction books into powerful knowledge, accessible in just minutes. With millions of users worldwide, we rely on data to fuel our growth, drive innovation, and deliver value to our customers.

Join our team as a Data Analyst (Analytics Engineering Focus) with a passion for leveraging dbt to power data-driven decision-making. In this role, you’ll design, develop, and optimize data transformation pipelines to deliver reliable, high-quality data that drives business impact. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align data solutions with strategic goals and turn complex datasets into actionable insights that make a difference.

A few notes about the position:


This is a one-year, full-time maternity cover position.
Check out the hiring process here: https://jobs.blinkist.com/c70 🚀


What You'll Do

Build and Optimize DBT Models:

Design, develop, and maintain dbt models to transform raw data into clean, structured, and actionable datasets. Ensure models are performant, scalable, and aligned with business goals.

Integrate Data Pipelines:

Work with data engineers to embed dbt workflows into reliable, end-to-end pipelines. Automate and streamline data delivery for analytics and reporting needs.

Align Data with Business Goals:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their objectives and create data solutions that drive measurable business outcomes. Deliver insights that solve actual business problems. Keep stakeholders informed and educated about how your work can help them grow the business.

Ensure Data Quality:

Implement robust testing frameworks, including unit tests and data quality checks, to maintain accuracy and consistency. Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies.

Enable Analytics:

Support analysts and business teams by providing actionable, easy-to-understand data insights. Translate technical concepts into clear, business-friendly recommendations.

What We're Looking For


Data Enthusiasm: You have a passion for clean, well-structured data and the curiosity to explore and find impactful solutions.
Strong SQL Skills: You write SQL like a second language, with experience building complex queries and optimizing performance.
Hands-on Experience with dbt: You’ve successfully used dbt to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data is reliable and accessible.
You want to achieve results, together: You want to see the outcome of your work. You’re not afraid to deprioritize “busy-work” and you love to succeed as a team.
Business Impact Mindset: You approach technical challenges with a focus on driving business results and solving real-world problems.
Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in team settings, working with others to align on goals and deliver results.
Growth Mindset: You embrace challenges, learn quickly, and seek opportunities to grow personally and professionally.

Great to Haves


Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and their integration with dbt models.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD workflows.
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis or scripting.
Understanding of data security, and compliance best practices.


Why Blinkist/Go1

Our unique culture of empowerment, mutual respect, and transparency has always been our defining characteristic. We support each other and carve out opportunities for every individual to develop and grow. We strongly believe that diversity powers innovation, thus we celebrate and support our differences, providing equal opportunities for employment and career growth. We embrace a flexible, remote-friendly way of working that supports different needs and lifestyles.

These are some of our most valued benefits:


30 PTO days + Wellbeing days + Learning days
Flexible approach to work
Monthly work-from-home or transport reimbursement
One time work from home office set up budget
Employee Stock Option Plan
Unlimited access to the Go1 Learning Hub and Blinkist app
Professional development fund
Volunteer leave to give back to the community
Family planning & parental leave, plus support for parents returning to work
Wellness initiatives and an Employee Assistance Program


If you choose to join our team in Berlin, you'll have access to our modern office space in Neukölln and enjoy healthy plant-based meals prepared fresh every day by our very own chef. 🥑

Apply Now

If we’ve captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas – apply now and tell us what got you excited about this opportunity.

We look forward to hearing from you! ☀️

🔎 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We’d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Information on how we process your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy: Blinkist Privacy Policy (English) / Blinkist Privacy Policy (German)

If we’ve captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas – apply now and tell us what got you excited about this opportunity.

🔎 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We’d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Information on how we process your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy: Blinkist Privacy Policy (English) / Blinkist Privacy Policy (German)

Title: Lead Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Berlin, London, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Puneet, Co- founder and CPO at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will be a part of the our Data Analytics ( Data ) team. 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen is a mobile demand-side platform (DSP) dedicated to democratizing programmatic advertising. We enable leading apps, agencies, media buyers, and brands to run programmatic customer acquisition, retargeting, and brand performance campaigns through its self-serve and managed service options.

Built on the three core pillars of performance, transparency, and control, Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams with bespoke solutions that fuel business growth and deliver a competitive advantage.

With an unprecedented scale of 160B+ daily ad requests from 1.6B+ unique users worldwide, we serve up to 1B+ ads per day in 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs and user interface.

The role

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will ensure that the Data Analytics team consistently applies advanced descriptive, prescriptive, and predictive analytics to deliver high-value insights across multiple stakeholders. At Kayzen, our Data Analytics team operates within the broader "Data Team," which also includes Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering. Collectively, the Data Team develops and deploys the machine learning models that power our clients' advertising performance in the programmatic ecosystem.

Within this structure, the Data Analytics team serves as a critical bridge between the Data Team and the broader business units (e.g., campaign managers, business owners, product managers).

Through your leadership, you will champion a data-driven culture and empower teams across Kayzen to harness analytical insights in a consistent and impactful way.

Responsibilities

As a hands-on leader, you will combine technical prowess with strategic vision—driving complex analysis, mentoring team members, and tackling data challenges directly. You will address a variety of problems, such as feature engineering, A/B testing, fraud detection, bidding decisions to name a few examples. Your key responsibilities include:


Team Leadership & Mentorship: Guide and develop the Data Analytics team, ensuring the quality and impact of their deliverables.
Roadmap Definition: Shape both the Data Analytics roadmap and the broader Data Team roadmap, making decisions that align with business priorities and objectives.
Data-Driven Model Research: Provide in-depth research to inform machine learning model development, leveraging both internal and external data sources to generate actionable insights.
Analytical & Statistical Expertise: Serve as the primary source of rigorous analytics for various data problems, evaluating system performance , finding performance issues and devising solutions for them
Data Accessibility & Quality Control: Facilitate data access throughout the organization while maintaining a centralized oversight to guarantee data quality.


What this role is not about:


This is not a typical BI role, where you are just expected to receive requirements and build dashboards. At Kayzen, the Data Analyst role is more investigative and we need people capable to ask questions and to answer them.
This is not a campaign management role, where you will be responsible for operational campaign optimization.


Requirements


5+ years of experience in the Ad-Tech industry, working in Data Analytics or related fields;
SQL (advanced);
Python (intermediate);
Expertise in data mining, processing, modeling and data visualization and strong analytical skills;
A results-driven, hands-on mindset that combines rapid experimentation, pragmatic problem-solving, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer-focused solutions;
High level of proactiveness and eagerness to solve issues;
A strong sense of ownership and strong work ethics;
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Hive, etc) is a plus;
Experience with Git and Airflow is a plus.


What do we offer?


Reporting directly to Co-founder & CPO
Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries
A flexible work-from-home arrangement
A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget
Show more

  • A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries

Title: Data Analyst | Junior PM
Description:
This role requires presence in our Berlin office. Native German skills are required.

🌎 What we do

We build software that helps companies along the food system get to Net Zero.

~31% of global GHG emissions originate from food-related activities. For the first time in history, climate performance has become an overall business performance indicator. Enterprises are mandated by regulatory bodies to disclose their climate performance, which leads to increasing pressure from investors, competitors, retailers, and consumers to prevent and reduce their CO2e emissions. Over the next 10 years, companies have set ambitious reduction targets that need to be met. Enterprise software and new business processes can help.

We raised >€10m in funding in the first 2 years of our existence, we launched our enterprise product, signed and onboarded some of the largest F&B players in Europe, and put together what we believe is the best-suited early stage tech team in Europe. Will you be the next to join us? 🚀

🔭 What you will work on

Your mission

Help our users make sense of their data and pave the way to Net Zero Emissions.

Over the next 12 months you will:


Create Actionable Insights for Net Zero
Identify data patterns to help users understand and communicate their carbon footprints more effectively to customers and suppliers.
Turn emission data into clear, impactful analytics for users so they can make better decisions.
Bridge data to real-world measures - our users and farmers don’t live in spreadsheets.
Build Prototypes and Products
Develop models and prototypes to help clients set targets and model Net Zero scenarios.
Develop a strong understanding of our users and their unique challenges.
Work closely with the product team to transform prototypes into scalable SaaS products.
Upskill the Team with Data & AI
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and AI product building.
Empower self-service across teams.
Foster a data-first culture in a fast-growing environment where it’s easy to simply listen to your gut feeling.

🚀 You might be really good for this role if


You have a "get-it-done" attitude and the ability to learn really fast.
You have built products from scratch in the past, be it on your own or as part of a bigger undertaking inside your company.
You were part of the first 1-50 employees at an early stage technology company, no matter in what position.
You understand and care equally as much about the “why” behind the numbers, you think outcome-first.
You are highly reliable and can organise your work really well.


You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria? We get it: confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But guess what?! There is no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. The only thing you need to ensure along the recruiting process and beyond is that the problem that we are solving with Root is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning! 🤗

🦾 How we support you


You will report to our co-founder Eric


Some of our angel investors that will actively mentor you:

General mentors for product


Vassili Samolis (Director Product @Doordash, ex-Instagram, ex-Pinterest)
Victor Landau (VP Product @cargo.one)


For more technical questions


Pete Hamilton (co-founder & CTO @incident.io)
Tevfik Aloglu (Co-founder @Pyne, ex-BCG DV, ex-Rocket Internet)


For collaboration with design


Jasson Schrock (first designer @Youtube after acquisition, ex-Google, ex-BCG DV)


🎢 Hiring Process

Our ambition is to offer you an end-to-end experience that is fast and uncomplicated - we aim to keep the end-to-end process to 10 working days. We send you prep material for each step and maximise transparency at every step.

Get Mentored By World-class Company Builders

We decided on our cap table with a clear goal in mind: Set our team up for success. This is why we have selected a diverse group of food industry veterans, generalist company builders, and functional experts to join our journey from day 1. Beyond entrusting us with their capital, our angel investors act as mentors and sparring partners for our early team members in their corresponding roles. You will benefit from:


A dedicated mentor with whom you will build your personal relationship
Regular sparring sessions whenever you see fit
Adhoc Q&A where needed


Not looking for a new role but know someone who does?

Refer a hire and get € 1,000 on the hand (or via Paypal if you are more old-school). Just forward the page to anyone that might be interested or directly message our team at hiring@rootglobal.io

_______

Root Global is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Show more
