Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Titan Group provides a broad range of services across the whole wealth value chain – from financial planning, investment management through to platform, trading, settlement and custody services. Its strategy is to be able to offer modular, incremental services to its clients allowing them to adjust their business models as and when they choose to. As part of this Titan is also an active acquirer of UK based asset managers and other wealth related businesses.

Due to this Titan Wealth is expanding rapidly through strategic acquisitions, offering a unique combination of start-up energy and the security of private equity backing. It’s an inspiring time to join the team!

The primary purpose of this role is to contribute to the roadmap and data strategy to enable the organisation to reach their goal of being data driven. This includes development of processes and metrics that create efficiencies and expand company’s analytical capabilities.

Job Responsibilities


Be able to input from designing processes, to building scalable tools and robust data sources
Proactively engage with other departments to support wider data strategy
Understand and interrogate the data, providing challenge, if necessary, to the team
Contribute to thought leadership and trend analysis
Monitor and troubleshoot processes, identify issues, and implement solutions to ensure data integrity and efficiency
Pioneer analytical techniques focusing on investment analytics and data science
Maintenance, standardisation and quality control of the third-party data
Contribute to the data projects which are being undertaken by the Titan Data Services team



Job Requirements


Educated to degree level, holding a Maths or Science-based degree and/or relevant professional qualification
Coding, investment, and database management experience is essential
Sound knowledge of investment terminology and statistical analysis
Proficiency in programming languages, especially Python
Experience in using data visualisation software, such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge operating with Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards is welcome as is experience with Microsoft Azure and DevOps
Good understanding of the business processes required to support customers and internal stakeholders
Good project management skills and ability to analyse large amounts of information quickly
Attention to detail



Our employees are talented people, distinguished by excellence. You will be able to demonstrate a willingness to embrace the Company values of:

Professionalism - how we treat our clients and colleagues.

Trust - embrace innovation and adapt to change.

Innovation - dare to create and don't fear failure.

Terms

Competitive salary

Hybrid working

25 days annual leave + public holidays

A range of benefits which includes private medical insurance, Group life insurance, and income protection insurance.

6% employer pension contribution

Further education and training support

Discretionary performance related bonus

Confidential Employee Assistance Programme

2 days per year for voluntary work

“Salary Extras” employee discounts

The Titan Wealth Group is firmly committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable environment for everyone who works with us, regardless of their race, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, physical ability or disability, or political affiliation. We believe that having a diverse team allows us to create the best possible outcomes for our clients and team members. We strive to provide equal opportunities in all aspects of the workplace with respect to recruitment and career advancement, pay and benefits, training and development opportunities and other job-related activities.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (FINTECH)
Description:
Do you want to join a global high-frequency trading firm and make a real impact at the crossroads of technology, quantitative research, and trading?




Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in their data operations. In this fast-paced, high-stakes environment, you’ll be working with cutting-edge technology to empower trading teams and drive success.




What You’ll Do

Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and consistency across systems to support research and trading activities.
Data Evaluation: Analyze complex datasets and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.
Monitoring: Oversee data production processes and maintain smooth operations.
Problem Solving: Perform root cause analyses to resolve data quality issues swiftly and effectively.




What We’re Looking For

Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python is a must.
Trading Knowledge: Familiarity with asset classes and experience in the trading space is highly desirable.
Adaptability: Thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy tackling complex challenges.




Apply Today!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Join a Growing Market Research Powerhouse

Are you a data-driven individual with a passion for brands and advertising? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? If so, we want to hear from you!

We are a leading market research company known for our cutting-edge data analytics and deep understanding of brand strategy, experience, and communications. We partner with some of the biggest names in the FMCG, financial, automotive, leisure, and healthcare sectors, helping them grow and "glow" through insightful research. We're proudly employee-owned, a certified B-Corp and Investors in People Gold.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our project lifecycle, from initial design to final delivery. You'll work alongside a close-knit team of experienced researchers and analysts, contributing to both data-focused projects and those leveraging survey data across a diverse range of brands. This role offers the opportunity to develop your analytical skills, working with techniques like segmentation and driver analysis, and progress from standard marketing techniques to more advanced analytical methods.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior team members to design market research projects with an analytical focus (e.g., driver analysis, segmentation, conjoint).
Clean and analyze survey data, performing tasks ranging from creating simple tables to conducting complex explorations.
Work effectively within a team environment, contributing to the overall success of the company.
Communicate confidently and clearly with both colleagues and clients.

Essential Skills:

Strong proficiency in R programming (e.g., data wrangling, function writing, string processing). Knowledge of other statistical packages (e.g., SPSS) is a plus.
Expertise in MS Excel and comfort with MS PowerPoint.
Meticulous attention to detail and a systematic approach to coding.
A curious mindset, with the ability to understand client questions and anticipate their needs.
A talent for uncovering stories within data and translating them into actionable insights.

Desirable Skills:

Experience withanalytical techniques in primary research, including:
Regression techniques (linear, logistic, Shapley)
Segmentation
MaxDiff/Conjoint
Pricing techniques (Van Westerndorp, Gabor-Grainger)
Familiarity with MS Excel Macros or VBA.
Knowledge of dashboarding packages (e.g., Shiny, Dash, PowerBI, Tableau).
Working knowledge of Linux OS.

Desired Skills and Experience

Data Analyst - Join a Growing Market Research Powerhouse



We Are Aspire Ltd are a Disability Confident Commited employer

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst - Join a Growing Market Research Powerhouse

Are you a data-driven individual with a passion for brands and advertising? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? If so, we want to hear from you!

We are a leading market research company known for our cutting-edge data analytics and deep understanding of brand strategy, experience, and communications. We partner with some of the biggest names in the FMCG, financial, automotive, leisure, and healthcare sectors, helping them grow and "glow" through insightful research. We're proudly employee-owned, a certified B-Corp and Investors in People Gold.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our project lifecycle, from initial design to final delivery. You'll work alongside a close-knit team of experienced researchers and analysts, contributing to both data-focused projects and those leveraging survey data across a diverse range of brands. This role offers the opportunity to develop your analytical skills, working with techniques like segmentation and driver analysis, and progress from standard marketing techniques to more advanced analytical methods.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with senior team members to design market research projects with an analytical focus (e.g., driver analysis, segmentation, conjoint).
  • Clean and analyze survey data, performing tasks ranging from creating simple tables to conducting complex explorations.
  • Work effectively within a team environment, contributing to the overall success of the company.
  • Communicate confidently and clearly with both colleagues and clients.

Essential Skills:

  • Strong proficiency in R programming (e.g., data wrangling, function writing, string processing). Knowledge of other statistical packages (e.g., SPSS) is a plus.
  • Expertise in MS Excel and comfort with MS PowerPoint.
  • Meticulous attention to detail and a systematic approach to coding.
  • A curious mindset, with the ability to understand client questions and anticipate their needs.
  • A talent for uncovering stories within data and translating them into actionable insights.

Desirable Skills:

  • Experience withanalytical techniques in primary research, including:
    • Regression techniques (linear, logistic, Shapley)
    • Segmentation
    • MaxDiff/Conjoint
    • Pricing techniques (Van Westerndorp, Gabor-Grainger)
  • Familiarity with MS Excel Macros or VBA.
  • Knowledge of dashboarding packages (e.g., Shiny, Dash, PowerBI, Tableau).
  • Working knowledge of Linux OS.
Desired Skills and Experience

Data Analyst - Join a Growing Market Research Powerhouse

We Are Aspire Ltd are a Disability Confident Commited employer

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst:

My client within the higher education space is currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their current team. You will be working in the Data & Analytics team and reporting to the Head of Data. This role is based in central London and is 4 days a week in office with one day from home. This role offers the chance to join an established function where you can expand on your experience. But also develop your skillset and get exposure to cloud driven technologies.

Requirements:

Proven and extensive experience in SQL.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
Previous experience working in a Data Analyst role.
Experience in Data Visualisation eg. Power BI/Tableau/Looker etc.

What will make you stand out:

Proven experience in Azure.

The client is looking to move quickly and book interviews. If you are interested in the role, please apply and to follow up please email/message me on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst (AI Startup)
Description:
The basics


Your title will be Data Analyst
This role pays £50k-£80k/year + equity
Matt, Cofounder and CTO, is the hiring manager
We work Mon-Thu in our office in Chancery Lane, London


What are we building? An AI Executive Assistant

In 1930, the economist John Maynard Keynes predicted that we'd only be working 15 hours a week by 2030. Despite automation in agriculture and industry, that hasn't happened.

Why? The service sector. Walk around the average office and you'll see people's days taken up by emails, Slack and meetings instead of real work.

People in client facing roles - sales, professional services firms, recruiters - feel this most acutely. Instead of advising clients, they spend hours on admin. Following up. Scheduling meetings and taking notes on them. Answering repetitive questions over email.

We've built an AI executive assistant that looks at your emails, messages and meetings, and uses that knowledge to answer your email, schedule meetings, take next steps from meetings and organise your inbox.

Unlike other startups, we're a pure-play applied AI company, not a SaaS company with AI features hastily bolted on! We make use of the best techniques (fine tuned open source models, tool use, and retrieval augmented generation) and as a result, users send 53% of the email drafts we generate.

How has it been going?

Since launching in March 2024, we've gone from $0 to $2.5m in revenue across 3000 paid users. We did this with a team of 4, and without using any paid marketing until November.

We spent Q4 2024 in San Francisco at HF0, the best AI startup accelerator in the world, learning from experts like the CEO of Instacart, Head of Applied Research at OpenAI and the cofounder of Snowflake.

What do we value?

We're very intentional about adding new people. We think a small team of exceptional people working hard at a problem they care about will always beat a larger, more unfocused team. That means you'll need to bring an intensity to this role that might not be asked at other companies. But it also means you will be fast tracked into more senior roles and responsibilities far earlier.

We also believe in hiring people who want ownership and autonomy in their work, and giving it to them. Instead of just being handed tickets, you'll be proactively suggesting metrics that should be monitored and one off analyses that should be done, and proposing improvements to our analytics infrastructure.

What will I do?


Running analyses in SQL to make decisions on product, marketing spend, and pricing strategy, and communicating your findings, method, and recommendations in a clear way to both technical and non-technical audiences
Working with stakeholders in the marketing, sales, customer success and product departments to agree metrics that need to be monitored on an ongoing basis, then building visualisations
Working with data engineers to ensure data is modelled in the correct format to support data visualisation and more detailed analyses


What does our ideal hire look like?

You've worked at an early stage tech company (<100 people) as a data analyst or similar
You have an expert level understanding of both SQL and a data visualization tool (we use Metabase). If you don't know SQL to a very high standard, you shouldn't apply
You are excellent at communicating your analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences: the results, your recommendations, and the method you used
You can proactively structure an analysis given only a business problem
Urgency and intensity in your work


Our tech stack

Broadly, we use a fairly typical ELT stack. It's not a requirement to have worked with every tool we use, but the more the better!


BigQuery as our data warehouse
Metabase for data visualization
Fivetran to pipe raw data from third party tools (eg Stripe, which we use for billing) into our data warehouse
dbt hosted on Github Actions for transformation of raw data into production tables ready for consumption
Census for reverse ETL


The application process


Submit your CV (no need for a cover letter)
An initial call with someone from the Fyxer AI team to review your experience and motivation for joining (15 mins)
Live coding exercise - SQL (30 minutes)
Analytical case study (45 minutes)
Meet Richard - CEO (30 minutes)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Applicants must hold an active SC clearance to be able to proceed with this role.*




Are you a data enthusiast passionate about uncovering insights and driving decisions through data?




We are looking for an experienced Azure Data Analyst to join an industry-leading client, working with cutting-edge technologies to deliver impactful business insights.




About the Company

This role is with a global leader in digital transformation and technology solutions, renowned for its innovation, customer-centric approach, and empowering culture. They collaborate with diverse industries to deliver scalable solutions, leveraging tools like AI, cloud computing, and advanced analytics.




With a strong focus on enabling businesses and communities, this company thrives on fostering talent and delivering impact in mission-critical sectors. For this role, you will focus on projects for public sector clients, where security and precision are paramount.




Why This Role?

Joining this team means becoming part of transformative projects that make a real difference. This organisation values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth, offering opportunities to use state-of-the-art tools like Power BI, Azure Synapse, and more.




What You’ll Be Doing

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will:

Apply advanced tools and techniques for data analysis and visualisation, including business intelligence tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Identify, collect, and migrate data to and from various systems, ensuring seamless integration and accessibility.
Manage, clean, abstract, and aggregate data while conducting a range of analytical studies.
Manipulate and link disparate datasets to provide cohesive insights.
Summarise and present data and conclusions in clear, user-friendly formats tailored to stakeholder needs.




What We’re Looking For

You’ll thrive in this role if you have:

Strong proficiency in tools such as Power BI, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, and SQL.
Experience with data modelling techniques, including 3NF, Dimensional Modelling, or Data Vault 2.
Hands-on experience cleaning, aggregating, and analysing large datasets to deliver actionable insights.
Familiarity with data migration techniques and linking disparate data sources.
Knowledge of agile methodologies and a results-driven mindset.




Bonus Points For:

Experience with Azure Purview or similar data cataloguing tools.
Advanced scripting capabilities in Python or other programming languages.
A background in developing or optimising interactive dashboards.
Knowledge of public sector environments and their compliance requirements.




What’s In It for You?

Collaborate with a forward-thinking team committed to innovation and excellence.
Work on meaningful projects for public sector clients, driving tangible results and societal impact.
Gain exposure to diverse technologies in a supportive and growth-oriented environment.




Interested? Apply Below!




Equality and Inclusion:

We are committed to creating diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from people of all identities and communities. Regardless of background, race, religious beliefs, or sexual orientation, we aim to empower good people to do better work with greater outcomes.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully Remote, UK or willing to work UK hours

Contract Type: Full-time, permanent, 40 hour per week Mon-Fri, subject to a 6 month probation

Interviews: Max 3 stages totalling around 3.5 hours

Reports to: Head of Product & Technology

Salary: We have benchmarked a salary in the region of £42-£50k, dependant upon experience

Why join us? 👋

We are a profitable SaaS business servicing the needs of international law firms and government departments, mostly in the USA and UK. We're on a mission to help our clients become as efficient as possible when it comes to managing huge volumes of information - so that lawyers and business leaders can stay on top of the news that matters, and as a result make faster and better decisions.

The Role:

We are looking for our next Vabler and are seeking a Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in driving insights that fuel user acquisition, retention, and expansion through the product itself. You will leverage data to understand user behaviour, measure success, and optimise our customer journey.

You'll act as a strategic partner, ensuring that all teams are aligned and data-driven insights are used to drive decision-making. We know that you will have meticulous attention to detail, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively across our fully remote team. Your expertise will help shape data-driven strategies to support our continued growth in the competitive SaaS market.

We would love to hear from you if you have the Essential Criteria below: 📬


Minimum of 3+ years experience in a data analysis or similar role, within a fast-paced SaaS business or technology environment (Scaleup experience is a plus)
A Bachelor's Degree
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages, such as Python, R or similar for advanced data manipulation and analysis
Have an understanding of the data pipeline, with a familiarity of ETL processes to ensure clean, usable data
Experience or education with statistical analysis techniques e.g., regression, hypothesis testing
Experience working with large datasets and deriving actionable insights
Strong SQL skills for working with AWS Quicksight to create reports and visualisations
Experience working with Google Analytics for user behaviour tracking and performance metrics
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across teams and present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Paired with wearing attire suitable for the role
The right to live and work within the UK or a self employed contractor who can work UK hours, within Europe



Desirable Criteria:


Proficient in Lucene query syntax for querying and analysing data in OpenSearch
A Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field / relevant certificates
Worked within a remote team before and have experience of the pro's and con's of doing this type of work
Familiarity with Hotjar for heatmaps and user interaction insights
Advanced Excel capabilities for quick data manipulation and supplementary analysis
Experience in a B2B environment
Worked in a similar size, scale up company



What would your responsibilities look like? 👀


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with departments, including Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Client Success, to understand their data needs and provide tailored insights
Provide statistical analysis to validate experiment results and recommend next steps
Ensure data integrity by regularly auditing and maintaining data cleanliness within systems like CRMs and marketing platforms
Partner with the Client Success team to identify and track key metrics driving client satisfaction and retention.
Develop models to predict churn and identify at-risk users.
Provide training and tools for teams to access and utilise data effectively
Build and maintain dashboards for real-time monitoring of these metrics
Interpret data and generate actionable recommendations for us as a team
Analyse client behaviour to understand engagement patterns, activation rates, and drop-off points



This is a great opportunity for you if:

🤸‍♂️You are interested in Product Led Growth and want to play a pivotal role in shaping data-driven strategies and providing insights that directly impact the company's growth in a fast-paced environment.

🌟 Work in Tech with an established product and have autonomy in your role.

💚 Become a Vabler and join a great team, fostering a culture of collaboration.

🎢 Join a company looking to scale and who understands people are their greatest asset.

🌍 Be part of a fully remote and globally distributed team.

About you: 👀

As a Data Analyst, your role is pivotal in driving data-driven decisions within Vable and ensuring our success with the data provided. In addition to our essential criteria we will be looking for the following mindset:


You're passionate about using data to solve complex problems and drive impactful change
You're self-motivated, work independently and take pride in delivering high-quality, impactful analysis
You proactively identify patterns, risks, and opportunities to build scalable, data-driven solutions
You're curious about how things work and how you can improve them
You're a collaborator who can build relationships across multiple teams, in an honest and meaningful way
You're structured and like organisation
You've an excellent work ethic and can manage workloads well
You are able to work effectively within a remote team, it can have its challenges



To be successful in this role, your values matter just as much as skills. Does this sound like you? ✨

🟢We are Kind and Empathetic = Our behaviour and words assume the best in people

🟢We are Always A Team = We are bound together by accountability

🟢We are Curious = A bunch from various backgrounds. We ask questions, plan things out, push the boundaries, challenge the status quo and welcome creativity

🟢We Take Ownership & Deliver = We are focused on our goals and love the details

✅Why work for Vable?


You want ownership of the Data Analytics within Vable
We have a culture that we protect, we value the contributions each Vabler makes
We encourage constant learning so you can keep up to date. A yearly budget of £250 is made available to each Vable employee for continuous learning and development
We encourage creativity and like new ideas and concentrate on the Cultural Add, not fit
We provide comprehensive healthcare cover following probation
You receive a MacBook, monitor and other required technical equipment when you join
33 days of paid leave a year inclusive of statutory holidays, based on where you live
Access to an Employee Assistance Programme through Oliva
We like our virtual socials and really do like to get to know everyone in the team
We are well established; we have been around for 20 years


❌Why it may not be for you:


We are a 40 hour week, Mon-Fri and have core hours, unless stated otherwise or agreed. Being a small remote team, it's how we operate
We have set norms and behaviours and each Vabler is expected to live up to these
While your primary focus will be on data analytics, you'll collaborate with various departments, addressing diverse needs and functions while adapting to shifting priorities. If you prefer a narrowly defined role, this may not be the right fit
We have various meetings per week and people are expected to attend and contribute
Our roles are quite generalist and you will be expected to do areas that you perhaps don't like or feel is not your job. No Vabler has this attitude and we get stuck in and pull our sleeves up. If this isn't you, best not apply.
Everyone has the opportunity to query, ask questions, have new ideas and we will give you our opinion. We operate on continuous feedback and recognition. This isn't for everyone and if this makes you uncomfortable or it's not your thing, this may not be the right fit
We are very transparent and all work is stored on shared drives. Colleagues will give input and it's expected that you will actively adhere to this approach



Interview Process 💌


Intro Call: You will meet a member of the People team for an initial discussion about your background, motivations and experience
Interview: If after the intro call, we're excited to proceed, you will be invited to a second stage interview with the Head of Product & Technology and another applicable manager. This stage will involve a task
Final Interview: Will be with the Head of Product & Technology


🎥 We record all of our interviews, with your permission. It makes it easier as we are globally distributed.

Vable is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.
Show more

  • While your primary focus will be on data analytics, you'll collaborate with various departments, addressing diverse needs and functions while adapting to shifting priorities. If you prefer a narrowly defined role, this may not be the right fit
  • We have various meetings per week and people are expected to attend and contribute
  • Our roles are quite generalist and you will be expected to do areas that you perhaps don't like or feel is not your job. No Vabler has this attitude and we get stuck in and pull our sleeves up. If this isn't you, best not apply.
  • Everyone has the opportunity to query, ask questions, have new ideas and we will give you our opinion. We operate on continuous feedback and recognition. This isn't for everyone and if this makes you uncomfortable or it's not your thing, this may not be the right fit
  • We are very transparent and all work is stored on shared drives. Colleagues will give input and it's expected that you will actively adhere to this approach


Interview Process 💌

  • Intro Call: You will meet a member of the People team for an initial discussion about your background, motivations and experience
  • Interview: If after the intro call, we're excited to proceed, you will be invited to a second stage interview with the Head of Product & Technology and another applicable manager. This stage will involve a task
  • Final Interview: Will be with the Head of Product & Technology

🎥 We record all of our interviews, with your permission. It makes it easier as we are globally distributed.

Vable is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salesforce/ Data Analyst – Ecommerce | Hybrid (2-3 days in London office)







A well-recognised leading technology company based in London is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Business Intelligence (BI) team. The BI team plays a crucial role in providing advanced analytics, data modelling, and cutting-edge data visualisation to generate strategic insights that drive business decisions.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic, engaging, and collaborative environment alongside a fantastic team.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop actionable insights and communicate key learnings to global business stakeholders.
Perform data maintenance, process reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data sources.
Develop and maintain business projection models to inform senior stakeholders.
Review existing data journeys and ensure data integrity across platforms (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud).
Maintain and support the creation of new data sources and data visualisations (Tableau).
Support the team with regular data transfers and uploads when required.
Promote data-driven decision-making across key business stakeholders.

Key Requirements:

2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong business analytics background.
Proficiency in Salesfoce
Knowledge of SQL and/or SOQL.
Experience using Tableau (or similar data visualisation tools).
Background in CRM marketing or data management (preferable).
Strong working knowledge of Excel.

What We Offer:

Flexible working (hybrid model – 2-3 days in London office).
Competitive salary & benefits package.




A fantastic opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment.

For more information, please contact info@freshtechit.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities

Our People Solutions team are looking for bright, enthusiastic and articulate candidates keen to gain experience and start their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive and attention to detail essential.

The successful candidates will be working closely with other analysts to learn the role and to support on the day-to-day needs.

You will be provided with structured and ‘on-the-job’ training, support with professional qualifications.


Manage, cleanse, and interpret internal data as well as client data.
Responsible for monthly uploads of claims and membership data.
Develop internal models.
Develop PowerBI dashboards for internal and external purposes.
Deliver claims forecasts on PMI and assist the actuarial team.
Carry out ad-hoc projects, across all lines of business, to support the business where possible.
Internal ‘go-to’ for excel support, client and internal ad-hoc requests.
Responsible for financial reporting for the People Solutions Executive Team


Qualifications


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong interest in programming languages such as DAX/VBA, R/Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Thorough and great attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Interest in the healthcare and risk market

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Permanent

Salary: Up to £60,000 + Benefits

Location: London (Hybrid, 2 days per week)




I am recruiting a Data Analyst for one of the biggest E-Commerce platforms in the game. You will have a huge impact supporting key stakeholders to drive the business forward.




This is a high-impact role where you will have the opportunity to work closely with the wider customer-focused team to help deliver impactful analytics.




Key Responsibilities:

Monitor and report on a variety of data points.
Help translate data into impactful actions.
Present value-adding insights and recommendations.
Evaluate and improve data entry processess and standards.




Essential Skills and Experiences:

Experience with tools such as Salesforce AND SQL.
Experience with BI reporting tools.

Up to £60,000 base + discretionary bonus

Employee recognition scheme (financial prizes)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In this role, you will develop a deep understanding of various business areas, assisting with day-to-day procedures and processes. Your insights will contribute to revenue generation, cost reduction, and enhancing operational efficiency. Collaboration with revenue-generating and business-enabling teams within TRS and the bank will be essential to understand their reporting and analytics needs, converting these into valuable outputs.




You will manage stakeholder expectations through clear communication, document all processes and outputs, and actively monitor data and reporting processes to investigate and resolve issues. Additionally, you will engage with stakeholders for continuous enhancements, ensuring that outputs are fit for purpose and migrating existing analytics processes to Power BI and the MSAzure platform where feasible. Working closely with the Platform and Data Engineering Team on the bank's “One Data Platform” (ODP) will also be a key responsibility.




Please note that this list of responsibilities is not exhaustive, and you may be required to undertake additional tasks as reasonably expected by your manager.




Core Skills and Knowledge




Career Background




2+ years of experience in a data and analytics function or industry is preferred but not mandatory.




Technical Skills




Proficient in SQL and data extraction languages, with experience in data visualisation tools like Power BI and familiarity with Microsoft Azure Cloud-based tools (e.g., Data bricks, Data factory, Synapse analytics).




Knowledgeable in Python.




Educational Background




A Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a numerical, computer science, or financial discipline.




Skills and Personal Attributes




Exceptionally numerate with the ability to interpret information and identify trends using advanced analytics techniques.




Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with adaptability to different audiences.




Strong project management capabilities, with self-management skills to research, design, prioritise, and deliver projects efficiently.




Eager to learn new skills and technologies, with a drive to improve processes and outcomes.




Honest, punctual, and committed to seeing projects through to completion, with impeccable attention to detail and the ability to navigate ambiguity.




Any Other Attributes That Would Be Helpful, But Not Essential for the Role




Technical (IT) Skills




Excellent Excel knowledge and experience in implementing advanced analytics or data science.




Skills in database design and modelling, along with familiarity with a range of Microsoft Power Platform tools and tools like Omniscope, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar.

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst - Subscriptions & Analytics - Power BI




Location: Central London




Compensation: £50,000 - £70,000 + Benefits




Type: Permanent




Are you ready to propel your career to new heights with a dynamic digital company who are truly value driven ? We're on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst who boasts a solid background in subscriptions and audience insights. If you're adept with Power BI and have a passion for turning data into actionable intelligence, we want to hear from you!




What You’ll Do:




Join a vibrant team where you’ll play a pivotal role in enhancing our subscriptions business. Your responsibilities will span a diverse range of tasks in an agile, fast-paced environment:




Harness data analysis to drive subscription growth initiatives.
Design and implement sophisticated data models for seamless automated reporting.
Analyze and refine audience segments to tailor our offerings.
Create engaging and insightful Power BI reports, while continually enhancing existing ones.
Ensure the integrity and flow of data and analytics within our systems.
Collaborate with product and audience stakeholders to refine data needs and insights.




Key Qualifications:




Proven experience in data and audience analytics, particularly in Power BI development.
Proficient in Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or similar tools.
Strong familiarity with marketing metrics and data from social media platforms.
Expertise in Power BI, including DAX and M for effective data modelling and visualization.
Competent in connecting to both SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Detail-oriented approach with a robust command of SQL for conducting data quality assessments and ad hoc analyses.
Understanding of data migration, ETL processes, and relational data structures.
Excellent communication skills, characterized by confidence and proactivity.
A data-driven mindset with the ability to conceptualize the end-to-end data process.
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, science, or computer science is preferred.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
We’re thrilled to offer an exciting opportunity for a Digital Analyst to join our Digital Analytics team at Harrods. In this role, you will be responsible for interpreting and analysing our digital data, while supporting our testing and optimization initiatives.

About The Role

As the Digital Analyst, you will contribute to several impactful projects aimed at enhancing our data and analytics capabilities at Harrods. This role will act as a central source of insight for digital stakeholders, including teams in Digital Marketing, Trade, Design, and Content.

Your responsibilities will include:


Conducting analysis to uncover opportunities and recommending tests based on data, trends, benchmarks, and competitor research
Collaborating with internal and external Analytics and Research teams to deliver coordinated insights that are inspiring, actionable, and results-driven
Staying up to date with key digital trends and industry developments
Supporting the communication of digital analytics findings to the wider business, including senior management


About You

The ideal candidate will have experience in marketing, optimization, or eCommerce, and a keen interest in expanding their digital analytics expertise. Experience conducting Quality Assurance tests and working with online measurement platforms and data is essential.

Additionally, you’ll bring:


Knowledge of digital marketing channels (SEO, Paid Search, Google Shopping, Affiliates) and concepts (attribution)
Prior experience using A/B Testing tools
Strong ability to manage conflicting priorities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A strong aptitude for processing complex data sets and analysis
Strong commercial awareness and attention to detail


About Us

Harrods is one of the world’s leading luxury department stores and we’re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world’s most inspiring shopping experiences.

Our Promise to You

Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we’ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.

In return you’ll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days’ holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.

Uniquely You

Whilst our job adverts outline the ideal qualities, skills, and prior experience for the role, we believe in the potential for growth and value individual strengths. If you can demonstrate the majority of skills and strong experience to thrive in this role, we would encourage you to apply.

At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.

If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you need support in completing the application or if you require a different format of this document, please get in touch with at UKI.recruitment@tcs.com or call TCS London Office number 02031552100 with the subject line: “Application Support Request”.




Role: Data Analyst

Job Type: Permanent

Location: Onsite (London)




Careers at TCS: It means more




TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We do not just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. For you, it means more to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation and thought leadership.




Be part of an exciting team where you will be challenged every day.
Work closely with the range of teams within the business to bring products to life.
Work with customers and identify opportunities to support their strategy and improve their processes across functions.




The Role:




As a Reference and Semantic Data you will design, analyse and reference data structures to support organizational data needs. In this role you will maintain and govern high-quality reference data, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance. You will collaborate with teams to align reference and master data strategies, focusing on enhanced data integration and governance.




Key responsibilities




Semantic and Ontology Expertise:
Analyze , Develop and implement ontology-driven solutions to enhance data integration and semantic interoperability across systems.
Semantic techniques to enrich reference data with contextual knowledge relevant to the life sciences and pharma industry.
Ensure adherence to industry standards for ontologies and semantic frameworks.
Expertise in ontology modeling, including classes, properties, axioms & instances.

Tool Proficiency:

Leverage tools like Ataccama, SciBite, TIBCO EBX, or similar to design and manage reference data solutions.
Evaluate and recommend tools and technologies to advance RDM and semantic capabilities.
Collaboration and Agile Execution:
Work in a cross-functional Agile team to deliver iterative solutions aligned with organizational goals. (SAFe knowledge preferred)
Contribute to the creation of data governance roadmaps and influence long-term data strategy.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into scalable solutions.
Roadmap Development and Solutioning:
Assist in defining the strategic roadmap for reference data and semantic solutions.
Propose innovative approaches to data management challenges, driving efficiency and value generation.
Getting in touch with Business for their reference data requirements · Reviewing the data shared by business and making changes to the definitions/ terms · Loading the data to the reference management system. · Making changes to existing reference lists ·
Customer engagement with strong communication, presentation, and articulation skills. ·




Key skills/knowledge/experience:




Experience as Data curator/ Data analyst with hands on experience in Pharma / Ontologies and knowledge of reference master data management.
Experience with tools such as Ataccama, SciBite, Reltio RDM, CENTree TibCo EBX, etc.
Knowledge of FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable) data principles.
Semantic and Ontologies Knowledge.
Reference Data Management and Data Governance knowledge.
Experience with SAFe Agile/Agile way of working.
Hands on experience with Reference data management tools such as Ataccama, SciBite, Reltio RDM, TibCo EBX, etc.
Attention to detail.
Experience dealing with stakeholders from diverse backgrounds across both business and tech.
Experience contributing to roadmap and solutioning.




Rewards & Benefits




TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.




Diversity, Inclusion and Wellbeing




Tata Consultancy Services UK&I is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the UK Equality Act 2010 and the UK Human Rights Act 1998.




We believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity and inclusion motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected across our workforce implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




You’ll find a welcoming culture and many internal volunteering and social networks to join (these are optional). Our diversity, inclusion and social activities include 12 employee networks such as gender diversity, LGBTQIA+ & Allies, mental health, disability & neurodiversity inclusion and many more, as well as health & wellness initiatives and sports events and we sponsor the London Marathon.




We welcome and embrace diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, disability, neurodiversity, gender identity, age, physical ability, gender reassignment, sexual orientation. We are a disability inclusive employer and encourage disabled people to apply for this role.




If you are an applicant who needs any adjustments to the application process or interview, please contact us at UKI.recruitment@tcs.com with the subject line: “Adjustment Request” or call TCS London Office 02031552100 to request an adjustment. We welcome requests prior to you completing the application and at any stage of the recruitment process.




Next Steps

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually on the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then it should be deemed unsuccessful on this occasion.




Join us and do more of what matters. Apply online now.

Rewards & Benefits


TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.


Diversity, Inclusion and Wellbeing


Tata Consultancy Services UK&I is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the UK Equality Act 2010 and the UK Human Rights Act 1998.


We believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity and inclusion motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected across our workforce implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.


You’ll find a welcoming culture and many internal volunteering and social networks to join (these are optional). Our diversity, inclusion and social activities include 12 employee networks such as gender diversity, LGBTQIA+ & Allies, mental health, disability & neurodiversity inclusion and many more, as well as health & wellness initiatives and sports events and we sponsor the London Marathon.


We welcome and embrace diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, disability, neurodiversity, gender identity, age, physical ability, gender reassignment, sexual orientation. We are a disability inclusive employer and encourage disabled people to apply for this role.


If you are an applicant who needs any adjustments to the application process or interview, please contact us at UKI.recruitment@tcs.com with the subject line: “Adjustment Request” or call TCS London Office 02031552100 to request an adjustment. We welcome requests prior to you completing the application and at any stage of the recruitment process.


Next Steps

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually on the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then it should be deemed unsuccessful on this occasion.


Join us and do more of what matters. Apply online now.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Simply Business helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Simply Business is an online business insurance brokerage that specialises in one thing: protecting the businesses their customers are working hard to build. Since they started life in 2005, they have helped over three million small businesses and self-employed people find the protection that’s right for them, from builders to bakers and personal trainers. Their big idea was to reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible, while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that they believe small businesses and landlords are entitled to.




Their story - continued commitment to doing the right thing




2005 seems like a long time ago. Simply Business – a small company with a big idea. To transform the way that other small businesses could get the insurance that they need. To reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that small businesses are entitled to. To protect them from harm. To keep their livelihoods safe. And to do all this with the promise of positive service. Delivered by happy people, working flexibly, learning constantly. With a restlessly innovative spirit. Within a business committed to doing the right thing. All of the time.




As they've grown, they've tried hard to keep true to this. To ourselves, to their 800 strong team and to the 3.5m customers that they've served so far. And as they move forward, as they enter a big new market, as they grow responsibly, as they improve their products, as they offer their customers more of what they need, of what they deserve, they'll hold onto the focus of that small company with the big idea. Protecting and serving businesses across the UK and the US. From barbers to bakers, consultants to cleaners, they are the backbone of the economy.




And they'll continue to stand by them. Bit by bit helping their dreams grow, just like ours.




Why do they need this role?




This role will sit within the global Data and Analytics team (DNA) in Simply Business. DNA has been central to empowering data-driven decision making at SB. They have invested heavily in their data pipeline, data engineering and their business intelligence capabilities.
In 2023 and beyond, they will continue investing a significant amount of effort in ramping up their Business Intelligence capabilities to drive business decisions.
The primary duty of this role will be to provide analytical support for their business stakeholders. This includes leading the measurement and evaluation of their product value streams and ensuring that they continuously improve the effectiveness of their product investments. Success in this role will require you to be a trusted advisor to their business partners, ensuring they focus their efforts on the most value-added insights initiatives.




In this role, you will:




Create data models in their Snowflake data warehouse
Integrate new sources of data to enrich their analytical capabilities
Work with the engineering and product teams to ensure application design accommodates reporting and analytics requirements
Work with various business and engineering teams to ensure reliable, scalable, robust architecture for their analytics platform and ETL pipelines
Partner with stakeholders to identify business use cases and translate them into the right analytical problem that you will build, test and productionize
Particular focus will be on use cases that will help them drive operational efficiencies as the organization scales.
Increase the organization's ability to convert more customers.
Clearly communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Contribute to longer term strategic DNA projects




What are they looking for:




At least 3 years of overall experience in data & analytics, operational analytics experience is desired;
Degree with analytics or software engineering experience or equivalent work experience;
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake or similar;
Experience designing and creating SQL data models using dbt (dbt Certification a plus);
Strong communication and data presentation skills through the use of effective data visualisation and BI tools, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc;
Effective at building strong, influential relationships with colleagues and partners, with demonstrated success in delivering impactful insights to executives;
Self-starter who is comfortable working in a globally distributed team environment
Experience in Python or another programming language (e.g. Kotlin, Scala, Ruby) is welcomed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Platform:

Real-time API data and third-party specification analysis
Data profiling and assessment of business value / quality
Data contract, mapping specification, and lineage creation and maintenance
Validation and acceptance testing

Skills:

Business Process Understanding: Ability to connect technical lineage with business processes, understanding how data supports decision-making or business operations.
Ability to break down complex API specs, understand underlying behaviours, and create data contracts.
Knowledge of using JSON Schema for validating the structure of incoming real-time data.
API Documentation: Familiarity with reading and interpreting detailed API documentation.
Data Quality Assessment: Understanding the dimensions of data quality, including accuracy, completeness, consistency, timeliness, uniqueness, and validity. Proficient use of tools for profiling and cleansing data (like Informatica, or SQL-based tools).
Understanding of Data Types: Familiarity with various data types (structured, semi-structured, unstructured) and how they should be handled in profiling.
Tools & Technologies: Proficiency with data profiling tools .
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying databases, extracting data, and performing basic analysis.
Clear communication to liaise with both technical teams (e.g., data engineers) and business stakeholders to agree on data definitions, structures, and rules.
Understanding of logical and physical data models.
Ability to define transformation logic for moving data from one system to another (e.g., mapping columns between source and target systems, applying business rules).
Technical Documentation: Skills in documenting the mapping logic clearly so that other data professionals can follow or update the specifications.
Validation and acceptance testing.
Understanding of Data Flow: Ability to visualise and document how data moves across various stages of the pipeline, from source to consumption, ensuring full traceability.
Metadata Management: Understanding of how metadata is captured, used, and maintained. Data lineage often relies on detailed metadata to trace data’s origins and its transformations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Risk & Fraud




Location: Remote (London Rate)

Fixed-Term Contract (Initially 6 Months)




Experience Level: Mid-Senior (approx. 5-7 years)

Approx. £104,000 (Plus Benefits)




Job Overview




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualization, Python, and risk & fraud analytics. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in leveraging data-driven insights to detect fraud, assess risks, and enhance decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, providing analytical support and developing models to identify patterns of fraudulent activity.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large datasets to detect fraud patterns, anomalies, and risk trends.
Develop and maintain SQL queries, dashboards, and reports to support fraud detection and risk assessment.
Create data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to communicate insights effectively.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and building fraud detection models.
Collaborate with risk, compliance, and engineering teams to enhance fraud mitigation strategies.
Monitor transaction data and develop predictive models to proactively identify potential fraud cases.
Provide actionable insights through exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and compliance with industry regulations.




Required Qualifications & Skills




5-7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in risk, fraud, or financial services.
Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large datasets.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent).
Hands-on experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with fraud detection techniques, risk scoring, and anomaly detection.
Experience working with large-scale transactional data and real-time fraud analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data patterns.
Excellent communication skills to present insights to stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience with machine learning models for fraud detection.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance in fraud prevention.
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Background in finance, banking, or e-commerce fraud analytics.




Why Join Us?




Work on impactful projects that combat fraud and enhance risk management.

Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - News & Media




💼 Salary: £25,000 - £35,000

📍 Location: City of London

🌍 Office Policy - Hybrid, 2 days per week in the office







📰 About Our Client:

Our client is a dynamic and innovative company in the news and publishing industry that has thrived through evolution and growth. As a leading digital media brand, they attract hundreds of millions of global visitors each month . They offer a collaborative and forward-thinking environment that values diversity, innovation, and data-driven decision-making. You’ll enjoy the perks of working for a large company, while having the opportunity to propose new plans and ideas.







📈 What you would do as part of your role:

The Data Analyst will support the ongoing growth of our client’s reader revenue strategy.

Deliver key insights into how users engage with content and provide valuable recommendations to drive user registration, subscriptions, and retention.
Lead data-driven projects and help shape the future of the business through analytics and reporting.
Suggest insights based on data, helping the Head of Trading make informed decisions.
Collaborate with editorial, marketing, and product teams, sharing reports and insights on reader behaviour and engagement .










💻 Who are you:

You are a recent graduate, with work experience in media, publishing, subscription, retail or a similar industry.
You have strong Excel skills, experience with BI tools such as PowerBI, Tableau and Domo.
You ideally have basic SQL Skills
You are commercially focused, able to explain how a company can make more or save money







🚀 Benefits:

Be part of a growing, global brand at the cutting edge of digital journalism.
Gain hands-on experience with analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, BI platforms, SQL, Python, and more advanced tools .
Opportunities to work on high-impact projects that directly influence business decisions.
Collaborate with teams across data, marketing, editorial, and product.
Work in a company committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.







Ready to take on the challenge? Apply here! 🚀







At 3Search, we are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for all employees and job applicants.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for innovative, analytical thinkers to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customers’ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from – supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 – 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful – these are underpinned by our central value “Customer First”. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

The Opportunity


The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team blend statistical techniques and ML to create value from data for our clients.
You will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify use cases and shape opportunities for delivering data science solutions, ensuring a clear connection to business benefits.
You'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to our clients. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language in a way that bridges the fundamentally theoretical aspects of these initiatives to the business needs. This includes translating between technical and nontechnical audiences.
You will work across industries and technology platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) working with structured and unstructured data from an array of data sources.



 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Lead and deliver innovative technical solutions that will meet the requirements of our clients. This will entail gathering requirements, analysing, developing, testing, evaluating, and deploying the appropriate solution through the full development lifecycle.
Maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results to technical and non-technical audiences.
Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods.
Conduct research from which you'll develop prototypes and proof of concepts.
Manage and mentor junior team members.



 

Person Specification


Extensive experience in comprehending business challenges and converting this understanding into practical data science solutions.
Previous experience of delivering data science solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure DevOps or similar.
Passionate about the transformative impact the right information can have on a business.
Strong grasp of statistical methods, experimental design and the underlying principles of machine learning algorithms.
Ability to transform, analyse and model data from a variety of data sources, extracting and interpreting trends and insights.
Able to evaluate the models and experience of implementing them as stand-alone apps and as part of enterprise technology stacks. DataOps / MLOps experience would be valued.
Strong Python programming for modelling and/or data analysis is essential, preferably with experience using the spaCy NLP framework and BERT.
Knowledge of database design as well as strong experience with SQL queries is desirable. Familiarity with R and other common languages and tools would be beneficial.
Proficiency in stakeholder management and an effective, persuasive communication style to explain technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
Background in Mathematics or Physics and experience working within Agile projects as a team member and Scrum Master.



Eligibility Nice to have SC clearance or individuals with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) who have been residing in the UK for the last 5 years are eligible to apply. Willing to travel if needed for client location (London).

We Care About Our Employees' Happiness By


25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
Flex benefits system – an exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
Retail discounts.
Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
Private Medical Scheme.
Life Assurance.
Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.

HTML:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.

The Opportunity

  • The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team blend statistical techniques and ML to create value from data for our clients.
  • You will collaborate with business stakeholders to identify use cases and shape opportunities for delivering data science solutions, ensuring a clear connection to business benefits.
  • You'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to our clients. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language in a way that bridges the fundamentally theoretical aspects of these initiatives to the business needs. This includes translating between technical and nontechnical audiences.
  • You will work across industries and technology platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) working with structured and unstructured data from an array of data sources.


 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Lead and deliver innovative technical solutions that will meet the requirements of our clients. This will entail gathering requirements, analysing, developing, testing, evaluating, and deploying the appropriate solution through the full development lifecycle.
  • Maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods.
  • Conduct research from which you'll develop prototypes and proof of concepts.
  • Manage and mentor junior team members.


 

Person Specification

  • Extensive experience in comprehending business challenges and converting this understanding into practical data science solutions.
  • Previous experience of delivering data science solutions using Microsoft Fabric and Azure DevOps or similar.
  • Passionate about the transformative impact the right information can have on a business.
  • Strong grasp of statistical methods, experimental design and the underlying principles of machine learning algorithms.
  • Ability to transform, analyse and model data from a variety of data sources, extracting and interpreting trends and insights.
  • Able to evaluate the models and experience of implementing them as stand-alone apps and as part of enterprise technology stacks. DataOps / MLOps experience would be valued.
  • Strong Python programming for modelling and/or data analysis is essential, preferably with experience using the spaCy NLP framework and BERT.
  • Knowledge of database design as well as strong experience with SQL queries is desirable. Familiarity with R and other common languages and tools would be beneficial.
  • Proficiency in stakeholder management and an effective, persuasive communication style to explain technical subjects to non-technical audiences.
  • Background in Mathematics or Physics and experience working within Agile projects as a team member and Scrum Master.


Eligibility Nice to have SC clearance or individuals with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) who have been residing in the UK for the last 5 years are eligible to apply. Willing to travel if needed for client location (London).

We Care About Our Employees' Happiness By

  • 25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
  • Flex benefits system – an exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
  • Retail discounts.
  • Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
  • Private Medical Scheme.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
  • Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.


As a Disability Confident employer, we aim to ensure that people with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for this position will be offered an interview. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments and changes as needed to the application and assessment process to remove or reduce any disadvantage associated with a person's disability.

Let’s grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
HR Systems & Data Analyst

Location: London (Marylebone) - Hybrid model
Salary: Up to £50,000

About the Role:

We are working with a leading British train operating company. Our client is seeking a HR Systems & Data Analyst to maintain, develop, and support HR information systems while providing key management data and insights. You'll play a pivotal role in enhancing HR processes, automation, and reporting to drive business efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

HR Systems Management - Develop, integrate, and optimize HR systems, providing training and support to stakeholders.
Data & Analytics - Produce and analyse HR reports, identify trends, and ensure data integrity.
System Administration - Oversee system security, GDPR compliance, and support upgrades and enhancements.
Process Improvement - Drive automation and efficiency within HR systems and reporting processes.

What We're Looking For:

Technical Expertise - Experience with iTrent, Business Objects, and Power BI is essential.
Data & Reporting Skills - Strong background in HR analytics, including Excel (pivot tables, v-lookups) and reporting tools.
Problem-Solving Ability - A proactive, analytical thinker who can troubleshoot and recommend system improvements.
Communication & Training - Ability to train and support colleagues in system use.
Flexibility & Attention to Detail - Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver accurate insights.

Why Join?

This is an exciting opportunity to work with a leading organization committed to continuous improvement, innovation, and professional development. Enjoy a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and the chance to shape the future of HR systems.
